description: An underwater kingdom located 10,000 meters below sea level, protected by a massive bubble. Fish-Man Island is home to both fish-men and merfolk, and serves as the gateway to the New World. The island appears beautiful and mystical, glowing in the depths of the ocean.

keyEvents.title: First Sight of Fish-Man Island
keyEvents.description: The Straw Hat Pirates finally lay eyes on Fish-Man Island for the first time, seeing the legendary underwater kingdom protected by a massive bubble.
keyEvents.significance: Major milestone in the crew's journey, as Fish-Man Island is the gateway to the New World and has been mentioned since the beginning of the series.

keyEvents.title: Confrontation at Fish-Man Island's Entrance
keyEvents.description: Hammond and the New Fish-Man Pirates intercept the Straw Hats at the entrance to Fish-Man Island.
keyEvents.significance: The crew's first hostile encounter at their destination, setting up the arc's conflict.

statusHistory.reason: Fish-Man Island is operational and inhabited

description: The deep ocean waters leading to Fish-Man Island, characterized by extreme depth, darkness, and underwater volcanic activity. This treacherous area is home to giant sea creatures and poses numerous natural hazards.

keyEvents.title: Undersea Volcanic Eruption
keyEvents.description: A massive undersea volcano erupts, creating chaos and forcing the Straw Hats to flee downward through an avalanche of rocks and debris.
keyEvents.significance: Major environmental hazard that tests the crew's abilities and leads to Usopp's technique debut.

statusHistory.reason: The deep sea remains a natural environment

description: Also known as the Ship Graveyard, the Sea Forest is located on the sea floor near Fish-Man Island. It features abundant coral growth due to light from the Sunlight Tree Eve, and serves as a resting place for wrecked ships brought in by ocean currents.

statusHistory.reason: The Sea Forest is mentioned/shown in this episode
